Generation V.Black: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
Generation V.White: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
Generation V.Black 2: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.
Generation V.White 2: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.

Generation VI.X: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
Generation VI.Y: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

Generation VIII.Sword: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won't come out of its boulder on rainy days.
Generation VIII.Shield: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They're mighty enough to crack Rhyperior 's carapace.

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Mirage Mountains (north of Route 125 , southeast of Route 129 ; both by Rock Smash )
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Mirage Mountains (north of Route 125 , southeast of Route 129 ; both by Rock Smash )

Generation VIII.Shield: Route 8 (One) Axew's Eye Rolling Fields , Giant's Seat , Stony Wilderness , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
